title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Corinthians chapter 4 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Corinthians Chapter 4.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 4:1, why do we not faint?
questions.correctAnswer: Because we have received mercy
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:1 states we faint not because we have received mercy and have this ministry.

questions.question: What have we renounced according to 2 Corinthians 4:2?
questions.correctAnswer: The hidden things of dishonesty
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:2 says we have renounced the hidden things of dishonesty and do not handle the word of God deceitfully.

questions.question: Who has blinded the minds of those who do not believe, as stated in 2 Corinthians 4:4?
questions.correctAnswer: The god of this world
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:4 explains that the god of this world blinds the minds of those who do not believe.

questions.question: What do we preach, according to 2 Corinthians 4:5?
questions.correctAnswer: Christ Jesus the Lord
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:5 states that we preach not ourselves but Christ Jesus the Lord.

questions.question: What has God shined in our hearts, according to 2 Corinthians 4:6?
options: The light of the knowledge of the glory of God
questions.correctAnswer: The light of the knowledge of the glory of God
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:6 describes that God has shined in our hearts the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: Why do we have this treasure in earthen vessels, according to 2 Corinthians 4:7?
options: So the excellency of the power may be of God, not of us
questions.correctAnswer: So the excellency of the power may be of God, not of us
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:7 teaches that the treasure is in earthen vessels so that the power is from God, not from us.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 4:8, how are we described when troubled?
options: Troubled on every side, yet not distressed
questions.correctAnswer: Troubled on every side, yet not distressed
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:8 states we are troubled on every side but not distressed.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from 2 Corinthians 4:9: 'Persecuted, but not _______; cast down, but not destroyed;'
questions.correctAnswer: forsaken
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:9 says we are persecuted but not forsaken, cast down but not destroyed.

questions.question: What do we always bear about in our body, according to 2 Corinthians 4:10?
options: The dying of the Lord Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: The dying of the Lord Jesus
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:10 teaches that we bear about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Corinthians 4:11 says that those who live are always delivered unto death for Jesus' sake.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:11 confirms that we who live are always delivered unto death for Jesus' sake.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 4:13, why do we speak?
options: Because we want to be heard
questions.correctAnswer: Because we believe
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:13 says we speak because we believe, just as it is written, 'I believed, and therefore have I spoken.'

questions.question: Who will raise us up, as stated in 2 Corinthians 4:14?
options: He which raised up the Lord Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: He which raised up the Lord Jesus
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:14 teaches that God who raised up the Lord Jesus will also raise us up.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 4:16, though our outward man perish, the inward man is not renewed.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:16 says though our outward man perish, the inward man is renewed day by day.

questions.question: What does 2 Corinthians 4:17 say our light affliction works for us?
options: A far more exceeding and eternal weight of glory
questions.correctAnswer: A far more exceeding and eternal weight of glory
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:17 states that our light affliction works for us a far more exceeding and eternal weight of glory.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 4:18, the things which are seen are eternal.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:18 says the things which are seen are temporal; the things which are not seen are eternal.

medium.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with discouragement during ministry. Based on 2 Corinthians 4, what biblical truth would you share about perseverance?
options: We faint not because we have received mercy and our inward man is renewed daily
We should stop ministry when troubles come
Perseverance depends solely on our own strength
We should avoid trials to keep faith strong
questions.correctAnswer: We faint not because we have received mercy and our inward man is renewed daily
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:1 and 4:16 teach that seeing we have this ministry and have received mercy, we do not faint, and though the outward man perishes, the inward man is renewed day by day, encouraging perseverance.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 4 instruct believers to handle the word of God in ministry?
options: Not handling it deceitfully but commending ourselves by the truth
Keeping the gospel hidden from unbelievers
Focusing on personal gain in ministry
questions.correctAnswer: Not handling it deceitfully but commending ourselves by the truth
questions.explanation: Verse 2 clearly states renouncing hidden dishonesty, not walking in craftiness, nor handling the word deceitfully, but by manifestation of truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience.

questions.question: What does 2 Corinthians 4 say about the spiritual condition of those who do not believe the gospel?
options: The god of this world has blinded their minds so the gospel light does not shine
They are fully aware but choose to reject the gospel
They are not responsible for their unbelief
questions.correctAnswer: The god of this world has blinded their minds so the gospel light does not shine
questions.explanation: Verse 4 explains that the god of this world blinds the minds of unbelievers so that the light of the glorious gospel of Christ does not shine unto them.

questions.question: When sharing the gospel, what attitude does 2 Corinthians 4 encourage regarding self-promotion?
options: Preach not ourselves but Christ Jesus the Lord
Use clever techniques to gain followers
Avoid mentioning Jesus to avoid offense
questions.correctAnswer: Preach not ourselves but Christ Jesus the Lord
questions.explanation: Verse 5 states that we preach not ourselves but Christ Jesus as Lord and ourselves as servants for Jesus' sake, emphasizing humility and Christ-centeredness.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 4, what enables believers to shine with the knowledge of God's glory?
options: God shining light in our hearts through Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: God shining light in our hearts through Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 6 teaches that God, who commanded light out of darkness, has shined in our hearts to give the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: What does 2 Corinthians 4 teach about the nature of believers as vessels carrying God's treasure?
options: We have treasure in earthen vessels so the power is from God, not us
We are perfect vessels with no weakness
Our power comes from our own abilities
We should protect ourselves from hardship
questions.correctAnswer: We have treasure in earthen vessels so the power is from God, not us
questions.explanation: Verse 7 explains that we carry a treasure in earthen vessels so that the surpassing power may be of God and not from ourselves, highlighting human weakness and divine strength.

questions.question: A believer faces persecution and hardship. According to 2 Corinthians 4, what hope should they hold onto?
options: Though troubled and persecuted, they are not forsaken or destroyed
They should give up to avoid suffering
Suffering means God has abandoned them
questions.correctAnswer: Though troubled and persecuted, they are not forsaken or destroyed
questions.explanation: Verses 8 and 9 assure that believers may be troubled, perplexed, persecuted, and cast down but are not distressed, in despair, forsaken, or destroyed.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 4 describe the relationship between believers' sufferings and the life of Jesus?
options: We always bear in our body the dying of Jesus so His life is manifest in us
Our suffering is unrelated to Jesus' life
Jesus' life protects us from all suffering
Suffering means we lack Jesus' life
questions.correctAnswer: We always bear in our body the dying of Jesus so His life is manifest in us
questions.explanation: Verse 10 explains that we bear about in our body the dying of the Lord Jesus so that His life also might be manifested in our mortal flesh.

questions.question: What does 2 Corinthians 4:13 teach about the basis for speaking and sharing the gospel?
options: We believe and therefore speak, following the spirit of faith
We speak only when commanded by others
Our words depend on popular opinion
We should remain silent to avoid conflict
questions.correctAnswer: We believe and therefore speak, following the spirit of faith
questions.explanation: Verse 13 states that having the same spirit of faith, we believe and therefore speak, paralleling the scripture 'I believed, and therefore have I spoken.'

questions.question: What assurance does 2 Corinthians 4 give about resurrection and future hope?
options: He who raised up Jesus will also raise us and present us with you
There is no resurrection after death
Our hope is only for this life
Only Jesus was raised, not believers
questions.correctAnswer: He who raised up Jesus will also raise us and present us with you
questions.explanation: Verse 14 promises that the one who raised Jesus will also raise us and present us with the believers, affirming resurrection and eternal hope.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 4, how should believers view their present afflictions?
options: As light and momentary, working out an eternal weight of glory
questions.correctAnswer: As light and momentary, working out an eternal weight of glory
questions.explanation: Verse 17 describes present afflictions as light and for a moment, working for us a far more exceeding and eternal weight of glory.

questions.question: What does 2 Corinthians 4:18 say about focusing on things seen versus things unseen?
options: We should focus on the unseen which are eternal, not on the seen which are temporary
Both seen and unseen are equally temporary
questions.correctAnswer: We should focus on the unseen which are eternal, not on the seen which are temporary
questions.explanation: Verse 18 teaches that we look not at the things which are seen but at things not seen, for the seen are temporal and the unseen eternal.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Corinthians 4 teaches that ministry should be conducted with honesty and integrity, avoiding craftiness or deceit.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 2 emphasizes renouncing hidden dishonesty, not walking in craftiness, nor handling the word deceitfully, highlighting integrity in ministry.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 4, believers are completely free from trials and afflictions because of their faith.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verses 8-9 explain that believers face trouble, persecution, and being cast down but are not destroyed or forsaken, showing that faith does not exempt from trials.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 2 Corinthians 4:7 says we have this treasure in ______ vessels, that the excellency of the power may be of God, and not of us.
questions.correctAnswer: earthen
questions.explanation: Verse 7 states we have treasure in earthen vessels to show that the surpassing power belongs to God and not ourselves.

hard.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Corinthians Chapter 4.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 4:6, Paul references God commanding light to shine out of darkness. Which Old Testament creation event does this allude to?
options: The creation of the heavens and the earth in Genesis 1:1
God saying 'Let there be light' in Genesis 1:3
The parting of the Red Sea in Exodus 14
The burning bush encounter in Exodus 3
questions.correctAnswer: God saying 'Let there be light' in Genesis 1:3
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:6 echoes the creation narrative where God said 'Let there be light' (Genesis 1:3), illustrating God’s power to bring spiritual enlightenment out of darkness.

questions.question: What is the primary reason Paul describes believers as 'earthen vessels' in 2 Corinthians 4:7?
options: To emphasize human frailty contrasted with divine power
To symbolize the temple vessels used in the Tabernacle
To illustrate the clay used in making idols in ancient cultures
To represent the permanence of the human body
questions.correctAnswer: To emphasize human frailty contrasted with divine power
questions.explanation: The 'earthen vessels' metaphor in 2 Corinthians 4:7 highlights human weakness, making God's power more evident, aligning with the biblical theme of God working through weakness.

questions.question: Which Greek word translated as 'manifestation' in 2 Corinthians 4:2 implies the idea of 'unveiling' or 'revealing'?
questions.correctAnswer: phanerosis
questions.explanation: The Greek word 'phanerosis' used in 2 Corinthians 4:2 means 'manifestation' or 'revealing,' indicating the clear and open presentation of truth to conscience.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 4:4, who is referred to as 'the god of this world' that blinds the minds of unbelievers?
questions.correctAnswer: Satan
questions.explanation: The phrase 'god of this world' in 2 Corinthians 4:4 is a title for Satan, who blinds unbelievers, preventing them from seeing the gospel’s light.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 4:10-11, Paul speaks of 'always bearing about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus.' What theological concept does this reflect?
options: Typology of Christ's suffering in the believer
The ritual sacrifice in the Temple
questions.correctAnswer: Typology of Christ's suffering in the believer
questions.explanation: Paul uses typology to show believers share in Christ’s sufferings (2 Corinthians 4:10-11), reflecting a mystical union with Jesus’ death and life.

questions.question: Which Old Testament Psalm is directly quoted or alluded to in 2 Corinthians 4:13 with the phrase 'I believed, and therefore have I spoken'?
questions.correctAnswer: Psalm 116:10
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:13 quotes Psalm 116:10, linking Paul’s faith and bold speech to David’s expression of trust in God.

questions.question: What literary device is prominent in 2 Corinthians 4:8-9 where Paul pairs opposites like 'troubled but not distressed' and 'persecuted but not forsaken'?
questions.correctAnswer: Antithesis
questions.explanation: Paul uses antithesis in 2 Corinthians 4:8-9 to contrast difficulties with divine sustaining grace, emphasizing perseverance.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 4:16-18, what is the Apostle Paul's perspective on outward affliction versus inward renewal?
options: Outward affliction is temporary; inward renewal is daily and eternal
Outward affliction is permanent; inward renewal is occasional
Both outward affliction and inward renewal are temporary
Neither outward affliction nor inward renewal matters
questions.correctAnswer: Outward affliction is temporary; inward renewal is daily and eternal
questions.explanation: Paul contrasts the temporary nature of physical suffering with the ongoing, daily renewal of the inner man, pointing to eternal realities (2 Corinthians 4:16-18).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 2 Corinthians 4:5 states, 'For we preach not ________, but Christ Jesus the Lord; and ourselves your servants for Jesus' sake.'
questions.correctAnswer: ourselves
questions.explanation: Paul emphasizes that the gospel ministry is about Christ, not promoting themselves (2 Corinthians 4:5).

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our mortal flesh' in 2 Corinthians 4:11 in the context of ancient Near Eastern concepts of life and death?
options: It illustrates the paradox of life through death, common in Hebrew thought
It suggests reincarnation as understood in neighboring cultures
It promotes ascetic denial of the body
questions.correctAnswer: It illustrates the paradox of life through death, common in Hebrew thought
questions.explanation: Paul expresses a paradox where death in the body reveals Christ’s life, reflecting Hebrew themes of resurrection and eternal life despite physical death.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 4:3, the gospel is hidden only to those who are spiritually lost.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:3 clearly states the gospel is hidden to those who are lost, emphasizing spiritual blindness.

questions.question: Which theme developed in 2 Corinthians 4:14-15 about resurrection connects with Paul's teachings in Romans 8:11?
options: The resurrection of believers through the Spirit who raised Jesus
The destruction of the body without hope
The necessity of good works for salvation
questions.correctAnswer: The resurrection of believers through the Spirit who raised Jesus
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:14-15 connects to Romans 8:11, where the Spirit who raised Jesus also gives life to believers, affirming resurrection hope.

questions.question: How does Paul’s phrase 'we faint not' in 2 Corinthians 4:1 and 4:16 frame the overall message of the chapter?
options: It emphasizes perseverance in ministry despite hardships
It teaches avoidance of any suffering
It endorses silent withdrawal from conflict
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes perseverance in ministry despite hardships
questions.explanation: Paul uses 'we faint not' to highlight steadfastness amid trials, which is a major theme throughout 2 Corinthians 4.

questions.question: What does Paul mean by 'all things are for your sakes' in 2 Corinthians 4:15 within the context of grace and thanksgiving?
options: Suffering and ministry result in grace that leads to thanksgiving and glorifies God
All material blessings are for the Corinthians’ comfort
Only financial gifts matter in ministry
questions.correctAnswer: Suffering and ministry result in grace that leads to thanksgiving and glorifies God
questions.explanation: Paul explains that hardships serve to produce grace that causes thanksgiving to God, thus glorifying Him (2 Corinthians 4:15).

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 4:18, Paul teaches that the things which are seen are eternal.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:18 contrasts seen things as temporal and unseen things as eternal, emphasizing eternal spiritual realities over temporary physical ones.

theological.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 4:1, what motivates Paul and his companions not to faint in their ministry?
questions.correctAnswer: Because they have received mercy
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:1 states that they do not faint because they have received mercy. This reflects God's grace as a sustaining power, consistent with biblical teachings such as Psalm 23:6, Lamentations 3:22-23, Ephesians 2:8, and Titus 3:5.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 4:2, Paul mentions that he renounced certain things in his ministry. What are these?
questions.correctAnswer: The hidden things of dishonesty
questions.explanation: Paul renounced 'the hidden things of dishonesty,' emphasizing integrity in ministry. This aligns with biblical teachings against deceit such as Proverbs 12:22, Ephesians 4:25, Colossians 3:9, and Psalm 34:13.

questions.question: Who is described as blinding the minds of unbelievers so that they cannot see the light of the gospel in 2 Corinthians 4:4?
questions.correctAnswer: The god of this world
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 4:4 names 'the god of this world' as the one who blinds unbelievers' minds. This is consistent with references to Satan or evil spiritual powers in John 12:31, Ephesians 2:2, 1 John 5:19, and Revelation 12:9.

questions.question: What is the ultimate purpose of preaching according to 2 Corinthians 4:5?
options: To preach Christ Jesus the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: To preach Christ Jesus the Lord
questions.explanation: Paul teaches that they preach Christ Jesus and not themselves, highlighting Christ-centered ministry. This aligns with Acts 4:12, Romans 1:16, Philippians 2:9-11, and Colossians 1:27.

questions.question: What has God commanded to shine out of darkness according to 2 Corinthians 4:6?
questions.correctAnswer: Light
questions.explanation: God commanded light to shine out of darkness, a reference to Genesis 1:3 and the spiritual illumination in believers' hearts. This is consistent with John 1:4-5, Isaiah 9:2, Psalm 27:1, and Ephesians 5:8.

questions.question: What is the meaning behind having 'this treasure in earthen vessels' in 2 Corinthians 4:7?
options: The power is from God and not from us
The treasure is fragile and easily lost
The treasure is hidden from others
The treasure is of little value
questions.correctAnswer: The power is from God and not from us
questions.explanation: Paul explains that the treasure (the gospel) is held in weak human bodies to show that the power belongs to God, not humans. Similar ideas appear in Jeremiah 17:9, Exodus 33:18-23, Isaiah 40:29, and Matthew 11:28-30.

questions.question: Which of the following contrasts is NOT mentioned in 2 Corinthians 4:8-9?
questions.correctAnswer: Weak but always victorious
questions.explanation: The contrasts given are troubled/not distressed, perplexed/not in despair, persecuted/not forsaken, cast down/not destroyed. 'Weak but always victorious' is not listed here. Similar themes are found in Psalm 34:19, Isaiah 43:2, Romans 8:35-39, and Hebrews 12:1-3.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 4:10, what do believers always bear about in the body?
options: The dying of the Lord Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: The dying of the Lord Jesus
questions.explanation: Paul speaks of bearing in their bodies the dying of Jesus, reflecting participation in Christ's sufferings (Romans 8:17, Philippians 3:10, Colossians 1:24, 1 Peter 4:13).

questions.question: What does Paul say is manifested in their mortal flesh according to 2 Corinthians 4:11?
questions.correctAnswer: The life of Jesus
questions.explanation: Paul explains that though they face death, the life of Jesus is manifested in their mortal bodies, echoing themes in Galatians 2:20, John 14:19, Romans 6:4, and Colossians 3:4.

questions.question: What is the effect of death and life working in Paul and the Corinthians respectively in 2 Corinthians 4:12?
options: Death works in Paul, but life in the Corinthians
Death works in both Paul and the Corinthians
Life works in both Paul and the Corinthians
Death has no effect on either
questions.correctAnswer: Death works in Paul, but life in the Corinthians
questions.explanation: Paul contrasts his own experience of suffering and death with the life that believers receive, consistent with Romans 6:8, 2 Timothy 4:6, Revelation 2:10, and John 10:10.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 4:13, Paul quotes Scripture saying, 'I believed, and therefore have I spoken.' What spirit do they share in doing this?
questions.correctAnswer: The spirit of faith
questions.explanation: They share the spirit of faith, trusting and proclaiming God's truth. This reflects Psalms 116:10, Hebrews 11:1, Romans 4:20-21, and James 2:17.

questions.question: Who does Paul say will raise up the believers just as He raised up the Lord Jesus in 2 Corinthians 4:14?
options: He who raised up the Lord Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: He who raised up the Lord Jesus
questions.explanation: Paul affirms God’s power to raise believers as He raised Jesus, consistent with Acts 2:24, Romans 6:4, 1 Corinthians 6:14, and 1 Peter 1:21.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 4:15, why are all things done for the believers’ sakes?
options: So that grace might abound to the glory of God
So that believers may gain earthly wealth
So that Paul may become famous
So that the law might be fulfilled
questions.correctAnswer: So that grace might abound to the glory of God
questions.explanation: Paul explains that all things are for believers so that abundant grace may abound and give glory to God, consistent with Romans 5:20, Ephesians 2:8-9, 1 Peter 4:10, and John 1:14.

questions.question: What is renewed day by day according to 2 Corinthians 4:16?
questions.correctAnswer: The inward man
questions.explanation: Though the outward man perishes, the inward man is renewed daily, a spiritual renewal consistent with Ezekiel 36:26, Romans 12:2, 2 Corinthians 5:17, and Colossians 3:10.

questions.question: How does Paul describe the affliction believers face in 2 Corinthians 4:17?
options: Light and momentary, producing eternal glory
Endless and punishing, for their sins
Pleasant and easy, as a reward
questions.correctAnswer: Light and momentary, producing eternal glory
questions.explanation: Paul calls affliction light and momentary, working toward an eternal weight of glory, paralleling Isaiah 40:31, Romans 8:18, James 1:12, and Hebrews 12:2.
